content.en: One morning, 5,000 runners went to Taipei 101, Taiwan's tallest building! They came from 34 countries. All were running in the Taipei 101 Run Up and some in the Towerrunning World Championship.
content.tw: 有一天早上，5000名跑者聚集在台北101，他們來自34個國家參加台北101 垂直馬拉松跟世界高樓登高錦標賽。

content.en: The runners entered the Run Up race one at a time. Then they started to run up 2,000 steps!
content.tw: 跑者一個接一個開始跑垂直馬拉松，要爬2000個階梯。

content.en: After a while, they didn't know what floor they were on! If a runner passed by, they were running too slow. When they passed a runner, they were happy!
content.tw: 過了不久，他們都不知道爬到哪一層樓了! 假如被其他參賽者超過，表示跑得太慢囉! 但只要能超過別人，就很開心。

content.en: After the finish line on the 91st floor, some runners needed to lay down on the floor! They didn't care about the great view!
content.tw: 終於抵達終點91樓，有一些跑者需要躺下來休息，根本不在乎絕佳的景觀。

content.en: This wasn't the end for the runners in the Towerrunning World Championship race! They went back down to the first floor. Then they ran up to the 59th floor... again! That was 1,400 MORE steps! That's why this is the most difficult tower race in the world!
content.tw: 對於世界登高錦標賽的參賽者來說，這並不是終點！他們回到了一樓，然後再跑到59樓，又多了1400多個階梯。難怪這是世界最困難的登高比賽。

content.en: A Malaysian man and an Italian woman won the championship and $109,000 Taiwan dollars!
content.tw: 一位馬來西亞男子和一位義大利女子贏得了冠軍和109,000新台幣獎金！

vocabulary.preface: 喜歡跑步的人，現在有好多種登高競賽可以參加。

content.text: 1. run 跑. It's three months after the earthquake,地震都過了三個月，and our elevators are still down? 我們的電梯還是壞的? Yeah. Want to run up? 沒錯。想跑上去嗎?
2) floor 樓層. Are you kidding? 開玩笑。My office is on the 19th floor!我的辦公室在十九樓! Lucky me. 我真幸運。Mine is only on the 9th floor. 我的只在九樓。
3) again 再一次. It's still a tough run up.跑上去還是很難。True, and to get lunch, I have to do it again. 沒錯，而且買中飯時還得再來一次。
4) finish line 終點線. Anyway, see you! 好吧，再見! Tell me when you get to the finish line.你到終點時跟我講一聲。You want to see who's faster?你想要看誰比較快? No, I want to decide whether I should go home. 不是，我好決定要不要回家。

vocabulary.postscript: 你喜歡爬樓梯嗎? run跑 floor樓層 again再一次 finish line終點線

quiz.question: 1. Where were the races?
2. What's the highest floor the runners run up to?
3. How many Taiwan dollars did the two winners get?

content.en: Four and a half billion years ago, Venus and Earth were born together. They looked almost the same. They both had blue oceans and green mountains. They were twin planets!
content.tw: 45億年前，金星跟地球一起誕生。兩個星球看起來幾乎一樣，都有藍色的大海和綠色的山，簡直是雙胞胎!

content.en: Earth is the right distance from the sun. Earth's oceans are full of water. Earth is warm but not too hot. The air is cool.
content.tw: 地球的海洋充滿水分，又離太陽的距離很剛好，讓地球很溫暖又不會太熱，空氣也很涼爽。

content.en: But Venus is too close to the sun. The sun's heat made Venus' oceans lose water.
content.tw: 但是金星離太陽太近了，金星的海洋都蒸發了。

content.en: Venus has a lot of volcanoes. Lots of bad gases came out of them. The gases made the air thick. The thick air kept more heat in. Venus became the hottest planet around the sun!
content.tw: 金星又有很多火山釋放大量的氣體，讓大氣層變得很厚，整個星球又更熱，成為太陽周圍最熱的行星!

content.en: Water is made from hydrogen and oxygen. In the thick air around Venus, hydrogen and oxygen are cut apart. Hydrogen goes into space. With no hydrogen, Venus cannot have more water. Now it's Earth's hot, dry twin.
content.tw: 水是由氫氣跟氧氣組成。金星的大氣層讓氫氣釋放到太空中。沒有氫氣，金星就沒有水，就變成現在地球又熱又乾的雙胞胎。

content.en: Scientists study Venus to learn how to protect the air and oceans on Earth. The story of Venus and Earth teaches us to care for our planet.
content.tw: 科學家研究金星，是為了學習如何保護地球的空氣和海洋。金星和地球的故事教導我們要關心我們的星球。

vocabulary.preface: 金星誕生的時候跟地球很像，後來的命運卻大不相同。

content.text:
1. blue 藍色、green 綠色
Look at the photos from the Space Station.你看從太空站拍的照片。
All those blue oceans and green forests. 藍海跟綠色森林。
Yeah, so pretty! 對啊，真美!

2. hottest 最熱的
But it's getting hotter, don't you think? 但是越來越熱，你不覺得嗎?
It sure is.確實是。
I bet this will be the hottest summer ever. 我賭這會是史上最熱的夏天。

3. sun 太陽
I wonder what's wrong with the sun. 真想知道太陽怎麼了。
The sun is not the problem! 太陽不是問題!
It's us humans on planet Earth. 是我們地球人有問題。

4. Heat 熱度
Actually I don't mind the heat. 其實我不在意熱。
I love ice cream and staying cool in the swimming pool.
我喜歡冰淇淋，也愛在游泳池裡保持清涼。

vocabulary.postscript:
你記得今天的單字嗎?
blue藍色、green綠色
hottest最熱的
sun太陽
heat熱度

quiz.question: 1. What did Venus lose because of the sun?
2. Why can't Venus have more water?
3. Why are scientists studying Venus?
options: b. To make water on Venus
c. To make Earth's air thick

content.en: Plastic garbage is a very big problem. We put lots of plastic in the ground with other garbage. This is bad for our Earth.
content.tw: 塑膠垃圾是一個很嚴重的問題，我們把塑膠跟其他的垃圾丟在一起，這樣很不環保。

content.en: There's also lots of plastic in our oceans. It breaks down into small pieces there. Ocean animals eat this plastic. It's bad for them. And many ocean animals die when they get trapped in plastic.
content.tw: 大海裡也有很多塑膠垃圾，它們被分解成小碎片，很多海生動物把碎片吃下肚，有的還會被塑膠纏住而死亡。

content.en: Plastic can take hundreds of years to break down. The pieces become too small to see. But they never go away…
content.tw: 塑膠需要花上百年才能被分解，雖然我們肉眼看不到碎片，但是它並沒有消失。

content.en: Now American scientists have made a new plastic. It's soft and lasts a long time. It can be used in shoes, pillows, and foam products. After the product is thrown away, the plastic goes away in about five months!
content.tw: 現在美國科學家研發新的一種塑膠，它是軟的，而且耐用，可以用來做鞋子、枕頭跟泡綿產品。這種塑膠只需要五個月就會被分解掉。

content.en: How does it go away? It's made with… bacteria! They're alive! They don't do anything in the plastic for a long time. After the plastic is thrown away, hot, wet garbage makes the bacteria grow. Then the bacteria eat the plastic!
content.tw: 這種塑膠裡有細菌，平常不會發揮什麼作用，但是被丟在悶熱潮濕的環境就會開始生長吃塑膠。

content.en: If companies can make and use this plastic, we'll have less plastic waste. Our Earth can be a cleaner place!
content.tw: 如果公司能製造和使用這種塑膠，我們將會有更少的塑膠垃圾。我們的地球就能變得更乾淨！

vocabulary.preface: 有一種可以消耗自己的塑膠製品，可能是未來的方向。

content.text:
1. waste 廢物
Did you see all that plastic waste in the park? 你看到公園裡那些塑膠垃圾了嗎?
Yeah, it's crazy! 對啊，真是瘋了!

2. go away 走開、離開
And they're always there. 而且總是在那裏。
They just don't go away. 都不走呢。
That's because people throw in new ones. 那是因為有人丟來新的。

3. use 使用
For me, I use plastic bags all the time. 我自己很常用塑膠袋。
But I try my best to recycle them. 但是我儘量回收。
Me too. I can't imagine not using plastic bags. 我也是，無法想像不用塑膠袋。

4. break down 分解
Someone should invent plastic bags that break down fast.
應該有人發明可以很快分解的塑膠袋。
But I hope they won't break down in my hand. 希望它們不會在我手裡分解。

vocabulary.postscript:
請跟我一起讀單字。
waste廢物
go away走開、離開
use使用
break down分解

quiz.question: 1. How long does the new plastic take to go away?
2. When does the bacteria eat the plastic?
options: c. When it's in the garbage

quiz.question: 3. How can the new plastic help our Earth?
options: a. People will use less plastic.
b. Our Earth will be cleaner.

content.en: Do you help clean your home? Maybe you vacuum dust from your floor.
content.tw: 你會打掃家裡嗎？像是用吸塵器吸家裡地板。

content.en: Hmmm... What can we do to help clean the Earth, everyone's home? The Earth's air has too much carbon dioxide. This is bad. Carbon dioxide makes the Earth warmer. It comes from cars, factories, and us! We breathe out carbon dioxide.
content.tw: 那我們該怎麼打掃我們的家園地球呢？空氣裡有太多二氧化碳讓地球更熱。汽車、工廠甚至是我們都會產生二氧化碳。

content.en: Well, we can't stop breathing! How about vacuuming? Some companies are vacuuming carbon dioxide from the air!
content.tw: 我們不能不呼吸，那如果把它吸走呢？有一些公司把二氧化碳從空氣中吸走。

content.en: These vacuums are VERY big. They cost a lot to make and use.
content.tw: 這種吸塵器很龐大，而且需要很高的成本製作跟使用。

content.en: The biggest vacuum now is in Iceland. Every day, it vacuums one hundred tons of carbon dioxide. Then the carbon dioxide goes down, down, down into the Earth. It becomes rock there! And it's there forever! This is good!
content.tw: 最大的吸塵器在冰島，每天會吸一百噸的二氧化碳到地底下變成岩石。

content.en: But... that's not very much carbon dioxide! Eight thousand cars make this much carbon dioxide. The air has a lot more carbon dioxide. Companies are building bigger vacuums! But we can't put vacuums everywhere! We have to make less carbon dioxide too!
content.tw: 但是……那不是很多二氧化碳！八千輛汽車產生這麼多二氧化碳。空氣中還有更多的二氧化碳。公司正在建造更大的吸塵器！但我們不能到處都放吸塵器！我們也必須減少二氧化碳的產生！

vocabulary.preface: 把空氣中的二氧化碳收集起來打進地底下，是不是很神奇?

content.text: 1. too much 太多 Do you know that new bus terminal? 你知道那個新的公車總站嗎? Yes, what about it? 知道啊，它怎麼了? It's pumping out too much CO2! 它製造太多二氧化碳!
2. breathe 呼吸 How do you know it's too much? 你怎麼知道太多? Because I can hardly breathe every time I pass it. 因為我每次經過幾乎都不能呼吸。
3. air 空氣 That's not good. 那不好。 That's very bad! 那很糟糕! I want to tell the city government about the bad air.我要去告訴市政府空氣太壞。
4. everyone 每個人 Do you think the city will do something? 你覺得市政府會做什麼嗎? Yes, if everyone complains. 會，要是大家都抱怨的話。 Do you mean me? 你是說我嗎? Yes! 對!

vocabulary.postscript: Do you think there's too much CO2 around? too much太多 breathe呼吸 air空氣 everyone每個人

quiz.question: 1. Why is too much carbon dioxide bad for the Earth?
2. Where is the biggest vacuum now?
3. What does the carbon dioxide go into?

content.en: Do you like stories about magic? How about stories about superheroes? These stories are fiction. Fiction means the stories are NOT real. But they're exciting! You can use your imagination!
content.tw: 你喜歡關於魔法的故事嗎？或是關於超級英雄呢？這些故事都是虛構的，不是真的。但是閱讀它們很令人興奮，因為可以運用你的想像力。

content.en: One girl loves fiction. She likes adventure stories. She likes stories about magic. But she LOVES fairy tales…
content.tw: 有個女孩很喜歡閱讀小說，像是冒險故事、魔法故事。她還特別喜歡童話故事。

content.en: Once upon a time, the girl had a question … Is reading fiction good for the brain?
content.tw: 有一天她想到一個問題，看故事對大腦有益處嗎？

content.en: One day, some scientists gave her the answer. They said reading fiction helps the brain in many ways!
content.tw: 有一些科學家給了她答案，說閱讀小說對大腦有不同的好處！

content.en: Fiction readers understand other people's feelings better. They think more clearly. They solve problems better. They're good at understanding ideas and things they can't see or touch.
content.tw: 小說的讀者可以更容易理解別人的感受，也更容易解決事情，他們把事情想得更清楚。擅長理解看不到、摸不到的東西或想法。

content.en: The scientists looked at studies on people who read fiction and people who watch fiction. They said reading fiction was more helpful for the brain!
content.tw: 科學家研究常看故事的讀者以及看虛構故事的觀眾的大腦，發現閱讀真的對大腦有益！

content.en: The girl is very happy! Now she knows - reading fiction is good for the brain in many ways! Now you know too. So everyone can live happily ever after! The End!
content.tw: 這個女孩很高興！她現在知道——閱讀小說對大腦在許多方面都有好處！現在你也知道了。所以大家都可以從此過著幸福快樂的日子！故事結束！

vocabulary.preface: 科學家說，讀小說對腦部發展大有益處呢!

content.text:
1. fiction 小說
What's your favorite type of story? 你最喜歡哪種故事?
Fiction. Only fiction can take me into another world.

2. read 閱讀
Like A Game of Thrones? 就像《權力遊戲》嗎?
Yeah, it's a wonderful story. 對啊，它是很奇妙的故事。
I love reading it.我很喜歡看。

3. fairy tale 童話
It's full of dragons, castles, kings and queens.
故事裡有龍，有古堡，國王跟王后。
Sounds like a fairy tale. 聽起來像童話。
No, good people die in that story. 不像，那個故事裡好人會死。

4. superhero 大英雄
And the superhero is a person with dwarfism. 而且大英雄是侏儒。
You didn't watch the TV series? 你都沒看電視影集?
No.沒有。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you like fiction?
fiction小說
read閱讀
fairy tale童話
superhero大英雄

2. What does reading fiction help?
3. What did the scientists say about fiction readers?

title: Will Taiwan Have Longer, Hotter Summers?

content.en: Oh boy, it's so hot. Let's go for a drive to cool down.
content.tw: 天啊，真的好熱。我們去開車兜風。

content.en: Ugh. There are so many cars on the road. Hey, we need to get some gas!
content.tw: 路上有好多車，而且我們還需要加油！

content.en: Summers are hot in Taiwan. We turn on air conditioners to cool down. Maybe we go for drives and use gas. When we do these things, we use fossil fuels.
content.tw: 台灣的夏天真的很熱，我們都會開冷氣或是開車出去兜風，都會用到化石燃料。

content.en: What happens if our fossil fuel use doesn't change? Climate change will make Taiwan's summers hotter and longer.
content.tw: 如果我們不減少化石燃料的使用，氣候變遷會讓台灣的夏天又長又熱。

content.en: By the year 2100, our summers will be 210 days long! Noooooo! Do you like 36-degree days? There will be 75 more!
content.tw: 到了2100年，台灣的夏天會長達210天！36度的天氣會多75天喔！

content.en: Climate change will also bring more heavy rain. More floods will happen. There will be fewer typhoons. But... they'll be stronger!
content.tw: 氣候變遷還會帶來強降雨，就會更常淹水。颱風雖然會變少，但是颱風的強度會更強。

content.en: Longer, hotter summers, more floods, and stronger typhoons will make life harder for everyone.
content.tw: 又長又熱的夏天、很多的水災以及強颱都會讓我們的日子不好過。

content.en: We need to do more to slow down climate change. We don't want longer, hotter summers, right? Let's find ways to use less fossil fuels. Seven months of summer is too long!
content.tw: 我們需要採取更多行動來減緩氣候變遷。我們不希望夏天越來越長、越來越熱，對吧？讓我們一起找出減少化石燃料使用的方法吧。七個月的夏天真是太漫長了！

vocabulary.preface: 又熱又潮濕的夏天，讓人很難受，而這種日子以後會更多。

content.text:
1. longer 比較長的
Working late today? 今天晚下班?
I'm not working. 我沒有在工作。
I just want to stay at the office longer. 我只想在辦公室待久一點。

2. hotter 比較熱的
To enjoy air conditioning? 享受冷氣嗎?
Exactly! 正是!
It's too hot at home. 家裡太熱了。
It feels like every summer is hotter than the last.
感覺起來每年夏天都比以前熱。

3. harder 更困難
That's so true! 真的是那樣!
And when it rains, it makes daily life harder. 下雨時也讓日常生活更麻煩。

4. change 改變
I used to love summer a lot. 我以前很喜歡夏天。
Not anymore. 現在不了。
Because summer has changed. 因為夏天變了。
Yeah, it has. 對啊，是變了。

vocabulary.postscript:
Summertime is getting longer... 來一起讀單字。
longer比較長的
hotter比較熱的
harder更困難
change改變

quiz.question: 1. If our fossil fuel use doesn't change, how long will Taiwan's summers be?
2. When will summers become that long?
3. How will typhoons change?

content.en: NASA is the space agency of the U.S. It wants to do many things in space. It looks for ideas to help.
content.tw: 美國太空總署NASA想要在太空做不同的事，NASA也會收集各種好主意來解決問題。

content.en: Many scientists have good ideas about doing things in space. Some ideas can help NASA. Scientists make these ideas better. NASA will use the best ideas in space!
content.tw: 許多科學家對於在太空中做事有很多好的想法。有一些可以幫到NASA。科學家們把想法變得更好。NASA會將最好的創意運用到太空！

content.en: NASA will send people to the moon. They need buildings to live and work in. NASA will use moon rocks to make buildings. So one idea is using robot carts on the moon. They can carry heavy rocks!
content.tw: NASA未來會派人到月球，這些人需要房子住跟工作的地方。NASA會用月球上的石頭蓋房子，就有人想到可以用機械推車來運送石頭。

content.en: The robot carts have magnets, so they float over a track. They don't have wheels or legs. They don't touch the ground, so moon dust can't stop them.
content.tw: 這種機械推車有磁鐵，讓它懸浮在軌道上，不需要輪子或是雙腿，這樣月球上的灰塵就阻止不了它。

content.en: The track pushes the carts. They can move thirty meters in one minute.
content.tw: 軌道會推動推車前進，一分鐘可以跑30公尺。

content.en: Like toy tracks, the robot cart tracks can be moved. They can be rolled out on the ground. Then they can be rolled up and put away!
content.tw: 跟玩具軌道一樣，推車的軌道可以隨意移動，也可以收起來。

content.en: Robot carts are a great idea. But there are many great ideas. Will we see these robot carts on the moon one day?
content.tw: 機器推車是一個很棒的主意。但還有許多很棒的想法。有一天我們會看到這些機器推車在月球上嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 有了月球推車，建造月球基地不再是空想。

content.text:
1. do 做
I'm so tired! 我累死了!
I want a robot to do all things for me! 我想要機器人來替我做所有的事情。
What things? 什麼事呢?
Shopping, cooking, taking out the garbage….買東西、煮飯、倒垃圾...

2. carry 帶著、拿著
He can also carry my bag and go to work with me.
他也可以拿我的包包，跟我去上班。
And do your job and share your pay? 並且做你的工作，分你的薪水?

3. help 幫忙
Do my job, yes, 做我的工作，對，share my pay, no. 分我的薪水，不行。
I also want him to help buy my lunch. 我還要他幫忙買中飯。

4. many 很多
You have so many good ideas about how to use a robot!
你對怎麼用機器人，好主意真不少!

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字都很短，卻很常用。
do做
carry帶著、拿著
help幫忙
many很多

quiz.question: 1. What is NASA?
options: c. People living on the moon

quiz.question: 2. What can robot carts do?
3. What can the robot cart tracks do?

title: Clothes Made of Human Hair Are Good for the Earth

content.en: I want to buy a new sweater. But I don't want to buy a cotton one. Cotton needs chemicals to grow faster. It needs chemicals that kill bugs. These chemicals are bad for the Earth.
content.tw: 我想買新的毛衣，但我不要棉花做的。棉花需要化學物質才能除蟲、長得快，可是化學物質對地球有害。

content.en: Should I buy one made from polyester? No, thanks! Polyester makes microplastics. They're bad for the Earth… and us.
content.tw: 那要買聚酯纖維做的嗎？也不行! 因為聚酯纖維會製造塑膠微粒，對地球跟我們也有害。

content.en: How about a sweater made of … human hair!? It sounds gross, but I heard it feels very soft!
content.tw: 那用人類頭髮做的毛衣呢？感覺有一點噁心，但是聽說摸起來好柔軟。

content.en: We take care of our hair every day. Some of us spend lots of money on our hair. But when we get haircuts, we don't want the hair that's cut off. Thousands of tons of hair become waste! But now, one company wants this hair!
content.tw: 我們每天都會保養頭髮，有一些人還會花很多錢保養。但是當我們把頭髮剪了，就不會想留下來。上千噸的頭髮變成垃圾，現在有一間公司卻想要這些頭髮。

content.en: A Dutch woman's company makes cloth from human hair. Her company gets hair from hair salons and washes it. The company makes yarn from the hair. It can color the yarn almost any color. It makes cloth from the yarn.
content.tw: 一位荷蘭女士開了一間用頭髮做衣服的公司。她的公司從髮廊收集頭髮，並且清洗乾淨做成各種顏色的毛線，再織成布料。

content.en: Hair doesn't need water, land, or chemicals. Using it cuts waste.
content.tw: 頭髮不需要水、土壤或化學物質，使用它可以減少垃圾做環保。

content.en: Maybe one day we'll be wearing clothes made from our own hair!
content.tw: 或許有一天我們會穿上用自己的頭髮做的衣服！

vocabulary.preface: 用人類頭髮來做衣服，原料取之不盡用之不竭。

content.text:
1. haircut 剪髮
I really need to get a haircut. 我真的得去剪頭髮。
It looks fine to me. Soft and shiny. 我看它很好啊。又軟又亮。

2. take care of 照顧
But taking care of it every day is too much trouble.但是每天照顧頭髮好麻煩。
I get it. So you want to cut it short? 我懂，所以你想剪短?

3. grow 生長
Yeah, much shorter.對，短很多。
My hair grows fast. 我的頭髮長很快。
Pretty soon it'll become long again. 沒多久又變長了。

4. company 公司
You can sell your hair to a fashion company, you know.
你可以把頭髮賣給時尚公司，你知道吧。
And a wig company, too! 還有假髮公司呢。
Great idea. 好主意!
